sec.p: We obtain the numerical results by solving the system of ordinary differential equations detailed in Supplementary Discussion I, by a Runge-Kutta scheme with adaptive stepsize-control. At t −, we distribute N = 10 6 points uniformly in the dimensionless state space region (− π, π) × (−3.2, 3.2) (the considered region of the state space). Since all possible attractors for all the considered scenarios are located within this box, we have referred to it in the main text as the “full state space”.

At the end of this simulation we mark, in the considered region, those trajectories which have converged to A 2 by t +. The criterion for convergence is that the trajectory gets sufficiently close to the attractor. This is checked, in each period, by computing the distance in state space between the trajectory and points on the attractor with the threshold for convergence chosen to be 0.05.
